guide.title: NIC Guide
intro_msg: Would you like a quick definition or an overview of the waves?
guide.definition_text: An NIC is a country experiencing rapid industrialization and productive upgrading, often driven by exports.
guide.waves_v1: Wave 1: Asian Tigers (South Korea, Taiwan, Singapore, Hong Kong)
guide.waves_v2: Wave 2: Emerging industrial countries (e.g., Malaysia, Thailand)
guide.examples_korea: South Korea: Developmental state, industrial champions, strong R&D
guide.quiz_question: Question: How many waves are presented here? (Hint: ≥ 3)
guide.quiz_almost: Close! We generally present 4 waves here.
guide.quiz_correct: Correct! 4 waves are commonly presented in this course.
guide.tip_cours: Presentation tip: navigate with ← →, Home/End, and 'T' for table of contents.
guide.tip_carte: Map: use wave buttons to filter and click on a country to see its profile.
guide.tip_compare: Comparison: add up to 4 countries then interpret the Chart.js graph.
guide.tip_timeline: Timeline: use ▶️, 'Next decade' and pills to navigate quickly.
guide.tip_default: Browse pages via the menu and explore interactive sections.
guide.example_korea: South Korea: Developmental state, R&D > 4% GDP, industrial champions.
guide.example_china: China: SEZs, massive FDI, upgrading, role of GVCs.
guide.example_mexico: Mexico: North American integration, maquiladoras, nearshoring.
